etymologies: 1940s; earliest use found in Journal of the American Medical Association. From nik- + eth- + amide

definitions: A derivative of nicotinic acid used as a respiratory stimulant and analeptic; nicotinic acid diethylamide, (C₅ H₄ N)CON(CH₂ CH₃)₂.

notes.text: A trademark for this drug is Coramine.
